ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Has anyone else used these recently and noticed?
ygData.msgSnippet: I was at the SoV launch party this weekend in Vegas.  I got a chance to talk to a couple of the live team folks and quized them on the changes to the Jonthan s
ygData.messageBody:
I was at the SoV launch party this weekend in Vegas. I got a chance to talk
to a couple of the live team folks and quized them on the changes to the
Jonthan's series. If you have not heard they are removing the rune
component and making the song self only (like the level 7 Jonthan song).
They are also greatly buffing the haste, defense, and attack bonuses of the
song. The goal, they said, was for these songs to allow bards to actually
*tank*. Should be interesting to see how they change.

Rokenn

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Donny Dane [mailto:ddane01@...]
> Sent: Monday, November 06, 2000 11:41 AM
> To: eqbards@egroups.com
> Subject: Re: [eqbards] Has anyone else used these recently
> and noticed?
>
>
> Ok, had a chance to quiz GZ on the songs this weekend at
> eqfest 2000 in
> Houston, TX.
>
> Pixe and such, are being/have been changed, during the
> patches that are
> going live...he wasn't specific on it.
>
> LULLABYE WILL BE CHANGED!
>
> GZ: "Look for some VERY interesting things to be happening to
> Lullaby soon"
> GZ: "We have been thinking about bard mez, we didn't want
> them to infringe
> on the Enchanter role, as that is what Enchanters do best,
> BUT we don't
> think that giving bards some mez abilities will hurt"
>
> These are not exact quotes, but pretty close.
>
> MacGrough Mich'Rathe
> Solusek Ro Wanderers
>
> p.s. One helluva weekend, even if it felt like being in the Karana's.
> EQFest 2000 was a blast!
> Check out eq.stratics.com and watch the official eq site for news!
> Thanks Ron!
